The Public Affairs Centre (PAC, www.pacindia.org) is excited to invite you to attend a session titled “Migration as a Win-Win-Win for the Countries of Origin, Destination and the Individual” to be held online via Zoom, at 3.30pm IST on Wednesday, the 10th of November 2021.

This session will be one of six member-led sessions in Southern Voice’s 3rd Research Conference on 9-11 November 2021: “Shaping an equitable post-COVID world: the role of Global South think tanks”. It will feature a diverse panel of speakers with available interpretation in English, Spanish and French.

We also invite you to explore the conference agenda  by visiting Southern Voice Research Conference 2021 | Southern Voice . Do  sign up ! .
http://www.southernvoice.org/

CEPA take great pleasure in sharing this post, where CEPA’s Chandima Arambepola will also be a panelist!

The USAID Industry-led Skills Development Program, together with USAID/Georgia’s Economic Growth Office Director Marika Olson, officially launched a new partnership with Georgian digital marketing company Sweeft to establish a short-term skills development program. With support from the Program, Sweeft will address the needs of software development and digital service markets by developing an accelerated internship program comprised of 20 new and improved short-term professional skills training programs focused on technical and soft skills in great demand by the ICT sector.

Tomato farming opened the door to greater profits for one youth group in Tanzania. With volunteer support through IESC’s Farmer-to-Farmer program, the Sasa Kazi youth group learned about tomato cultivation and soil health management, and decided to make the switch from maize and bean farming to tomato farming. This year alone, the youth have earned over $7,800 in profits from their tomato crops. Read more about their transformation here: http://ow.ly/MhUy50LR4w9

பெண் ஒருவருக்கு நமது சமூகத்தில் எத்தனை தடைகள் உள்ளன..?

எமது சமூகத்தில் பல்வேறு சந்தர்ப்பங்களில் இது தொடர்பில் பல காலமாக பேசி வருகின்றோம். இருந்தாலும் இந்த நிலையில் மாற்றம் ஏற்பட்டுள்ளதா என்பது சிக்கலாகவே உள்ளது. எதிர்வரும் மார்ச் மாதம் சர்வதேச மகளிர் தினத்தை கொண்டாட உள்ளோம். ஒவ்வொரு வருடமும் மகளிர் தினத்தை கொண்டாடுகின்ற போதிலும் பெண்களுக்கு வழங்கப்படும் இடம்தான் என்ன..? சமூக நெறிமுறைகளினால் பெண்கள் சிக்கித் தவிக்கின்றனர் என்று நாங்கள் சொன்னால் நீங்கள் ஏற்றுக் கொள்வீர்களா?

கடந்த ஆண்டு Transform Sri Lanka இது தொடர்பில் ஆய்வு ஒன்றை மேற்கொண்டோம். நாங்கள் இதன்போது வட மாகாணத்திற்கு முன்னுரிமை வழங்கினோம். இந்த ஆய்வின் மூலம் எமக்கு தெரியவந்த விடயங்களை உங்களிடம் கூறினால் சிலவேளை நீங்கள் ஆச்சரியம் அடைவீர்கள்...

"දේවානි කෝ"
========
පනුකරඳ ගහ විනාඩි 10 න් ගලවන් ගියා කිව්වම "දේවානි කෝ" කියල හොයන තක්කඩි රටේ ඉන්නකම් මේ රටට අබසරනයි. හැමදේම නිකම් හම්බවෙනකම් බලා ඉන්න රටක, පරිසර සංරක්ශනයත් කවුරු හරි කරල දෙයි කියල ඉන්න එක, එක අතකින් අරුමයක් නොවෙයි. ඒ අස්සෙ සමහරු හිතන්නෙ ෆේස්බුක් එකේ එන හැම ප්‍රශ්නෙටම නඩු දාන්න පුලුවන් හරි ඕන හරි කියල. මේ මොහොතෙ පරිසර නඩු 28 ක් උසාවියෙ කරගෙන යන අපියි දන්නෙ ඒවට තොරතුරු හොයන්න, උත්තර බඳින්න, විශ්වාසවන්ත පැමිනිලිකාරයො හොයන්න, ගාස්තු හොයන්න වෙන අමාරුව. සල්ලි හොයාගත්තත් මේ කුනුවුනු සමාජෙ විශ්වාසවන්ත පැමිනිලිකාරයො හොයන එක ලේසි නැහැ. සමහර ප්‍රශ්න සති දෙකක් ඕන නම් බුකියෙ කතාවෙන්න ඇති. එතනින් බුකියෙ යුද්ධය ඉවරයි. ඒ සමහර ගැටලු පරිසර යුක්ති කේන්ද්‍රයෙ අපි නඩු පවරල අවුරුදු 8ක් 9ක් උසාවියෙ ඇදගෙන යන්නෙ. ඒ වියදම මෙතන කියල වැඩක් නැහැ. රටේ බොහොම අතලොස්සකට විතරයි ඒ ගැටලු මතක. සමහර නඩුවලදි අපේ නීතිඥයන්ට විරුද්ධව හතර පස්දෙනා පෙනී හිටින්නෙ. ඒ අමාරුව දන්නෙ උසාවි ක්‍රියාවලියට යන නීතිඥයො. එක අතකින් මේව මෙතැන කියල වැඩක් නැහැ. පරිසර අරගලයෙ ඉන්න සුන්දර මිනිස්සු අතලොස්සක් වුනත් මැරෙනකම් ඒ දේ කරයි.

text: Through the USDA-funded Trade–Facilitating Agricultural Systems and Technology (Proyecto T-FAST) project in Paraguay, IESC has been working with Paraguay’s National Vegetable and Seed Health Service (SENAVE) to reengineer its processes to increase efficiency. As part of this technical assistance, IESC and SENAVE are conducting a series of 11 workshops to identify opportunities for improvement related to registration of national and international laboratories; registration of plant protection products; fertilizer registration; collection, shipment, and testing of plant and chemical samples; and issuance of plant transit documents. With IESC's support, the review and restructuring of SENAVE’s Strategic Institutional Plan will set the stage for SENAVE to contribute to improved trade facilitation. #SENAVE #USDA #TFAST

ගැහැණියට අපේ සමාජයේ මොන තරම් බාධාවන් තියෙනවද..? 
කාලාන්තරයක් තිස්සේ මේ ගැන අපේ සමාජයේ නොයෙක් පැති වලින් අපි කතා කරනවා. හැබැයි මේ තත්වයන්ගේ වෙනසක් වෙලා තියනවද කියන දේ ගැටළුවක්. එළඹෙන මාර්තු මාසයේ අපි ජාත්‍යන්තර කාන්තා දිනය සමරනවා. හැබැයි හැම අවුරුද්දකම මේ විදිහට කාන්තා දිනය සමරුවත්, ඇත්තටම කාන්තාවට තියෙන තැන මොකක්ද,,? සමාජ සම්මතයන් වලින් කාන්තාව හිරකරල, බැඳල තියනවා කියල අපි කිවුවොත් ඔබ පිළිගන්නවද..?

 පහුගිය අවුරුද්දේ Transform Sri Lanka මේ ගැන පර්යේෂණයක් කළා. මෙතැනදී ඔවුන් උතුරු පළාතට වැඩි අවදානයක් යොමු කළා.
මේ පර්යේෂණයේදී හෙළිදරවු කරගත් කාරණා ගැන ඇහුවොත් සමහරවිට ඔබ පුදුම වේවි..........

text:
Interested in abortion rights?

Join us at the Dublin Arts and Human Rights Festival on the 18th October at 7pm online - My Body My Choice: Abortion Rights Activism Across the Globe.

 The Repeal movement was one of the most important political and social movements in Irish history. It involved tens of thousands of activists from every corner of the island making the case for women to be allowed to make decisions for themselves, about their own bodies, their own health and well-being.

As we enter the final stages of the Government’s Abortion Review, we want to explore the challenges that remain since Repeal and hear how the struggle to widen access across the island of Ireland is part of a global movement for women and pregnant people’s reproductive rights.

Join us to hear from brave human rights defenders who are persecuted for their work on abortion access in Poland. Join us to learn how you can be part of the campaign for abortion rights at home.

This event features guest speakers Ailbhe Smyth,  Emma Campbell and Justyna Wydrzyńska. Ailbhe Smyth is  long-time feminist,  LGBTQ+ campaigner and the former founding head of Women’s Studies at UCD. Ailbhe co-founded and led the Coalition to Repeal the 8th, and was co-Director of Together for Yes, the national Civil Society Campaign to remove the 8th Amendment from the Irish constitution. Emma is co-convenor of Alliance for Choice and a core campaigner since 2011, helping secure decriminalisation of abortion as a part of the movement. 

Justyna Wydrzyńska is woman human rights defender and founder of the website Women on the Net, Poland’s first online forum supporting women seeking safe abortions, contraception or sex education. She currently works with Abortion Dream Team (ADT), a grass roots initiative of four women human rights defenders who came together in October 2016 with the goal of providing direct and immediate assistance to women who needed abortions. 

Register here:
https://smashingtimes.ie/event/the-struggle-for-abortion-rights-in-ireland-and-internationally/

🤬 Online abuse is a violation of human rights. Women must be able to feel safe in all spaces:
Their home
The streets
The Internet.

The Christmas season was kicked off at Mövenpick Hotel Colombo with their Christmas tree lighting on 08 December. 

With Christmas caroling, treats and drinks, this was the perfect way to start off the season!

Here are the highlights.

ඊයේ (11/07/2023)දින CEJ විසින් GGF හි මූල්‍ය ආධාර යටතේ කෘෂි විද්‍යාව ප්‍රවර්ධනය කිරීම සඳහා ආබාධ සහිත පුද්ගලයින්ගෙන් සමන්විත මහනුවර "අයිතිය උදෙස අපි" සංවිධානය සමඟ අත්වැල් බැඳ ගත්තේය. මෙම ව්‍යාපෘතියේ ප්‍රධාන අරමුණ වන්නේ දේශගුණික විපර්යාස අවම කිරීම, කාර්යක්ෂම ඉඩම් පරිහරණය සහ කෘෂිකර්මාන්තය ආශ්‍රිත ආබාධ සහිත පුද්ගලයින්ගේ පාරිසරික කටයුතු සඳහා සහාය වීමයි. මෙම අන්තර්ක්‍රියා අතරතුර, මිනිසුන් තමන් "වැඩ කරගත නොහැකි මිනිසුන්" ලෙස දැකීමෙන් සහ ඔවුන්ගේ ගෞරවය නොසලකා හරිමින් ඔවුන්ට මුදල් ලබා දීම ගැන ඔවුන් ඔවුන් කලකිරෙන බව අප සමග පැවසුවෝය. ඔවුන් දක්ෂ කණ්ඩායමක් ලෙස දැකීම සහ වෙනස් ලෙස සිතීමට ඔවුන්ව පෙලඹවීම ගැන CEJ අගය කළහ. ඔවුන් CEJ හි පාරිසරික අරගල සඳහා ඔවුන්ගේ පූර්ණ සහයෝගය ලබා දීමට කැමැත්ත පළ කරේය. නිශා ෂරීෆ් මහත්මිය සහ ඇයගේ කණ්ඩායම මෙම උත්සවය සංවිධානය කළ අතර හසංගි සෙනෙවිරත්න මහත්මිය සංඥා භාෂා පරිවර්තිකාව ලෙස සහභාගිවූවන්ට සහය විය. කථනය,ශ්‍රවණාබාධ සහ ලොකොමෝෂන් ආබාධ සහිත පුද්ගලයින් මෙන්ම ආබාධිත පුද්ගලයින්ගේ භාරකරුවන් ද මෙයට සහභාගි විය.

Yesterday (11/07/2023) CEJ joined hands with "Ayithiya Udhesa Api" an organization in Kandy comprised of physically challenged  people, to promote agroecology under the financial assistance of GGF. The main focus of this project is to support the environmental work of physically challenged people, related to climate change mitigation, efficient land use, and agriculture. During this interaction, they shared their frustration over people seeing them as "incapable people" and giving them money disregarding their dignity. They appreciated CEJ for seeing them as an able group and inducing them to think differently. They also offered their assistance and fullest cooperation in CEJ's environmental struggles. Ms. Nisha Sharif and her team organized the event while Ms. Hasangi Senevirathne assisted participants as the sign language translator. The participants comprised of people with speech, hearing and locomotion disabilities as well as guardians of disabled people.

நேற்று (11/07/2023) CEJ GGF இன் நிதியுதவியின் கீழ் விவசாய சூழலியலை மேம்படுத்துவதற்காக, மாற்றுத்திறனாளிகளை உள்ளடக்கிய கண்டியில் உள்ள "Ayithiya udhesaa api" என்ற அமைப்போடு கைகோர்த்தது. காலநிலை மாற்றத்தைக் குறைத்தல், திறமையான நிலப் பயன்பாடு மற்றும் விவசாயம் தொடர்பான ஊனமுற்ற நபர்களின் சுற்றுச்சூழல் பணிகளுக்கு ஆதரவளிப்பதே இந்த திட்டத்தின் முக்கிய கவனம். இந்த உரையாடலின் போது, மக்கள் தங்களை "திறமையற்றவர்கள்" என்று பார்ப்பது மற்றும் அவர்களின் கண்ணியத்தைப் புறக்கணித்து பணம் கொடுப்பது குறித்து உங்கள் விரக்தியை பகிர்ந்து கொண்டனர். CEJ அவர்களை ஒரு திறமையான குழுவாகக் கண்டு அவர்களை வித்தியாசமாக சிந்திக்க தூண்டியதற்காக அவர்கள் பாராட்டினர். அவர்கள் CEJ இன் சுற்றுச்சூழல் போராட்டங்களில் தங்கள் உதவியையும் முழு ஒத்துழைப்பையும் வழங்கினர். திருமதி நிஷா ஷெரீப் மற்றும் அவரது குழுவினர் நிகழ்வை ஏற்பாடு செய்திருந்தனர், திருமதி ஹசங்கி செனவிரத்ன சைகை மொழி மொழிபெயர்ப்பாளராக பங்கேற்பாளர்களுக்கு உதவினார். 12 பெண்கள் மற்றும் 7 ஆண்கள் உட்பட 19 பங்கேற்பாளர்கள் பேச்சு, செவித்திறன் மற்றும் லோகோ மோஷன் குறைபாடுகள் உள்ளவர்கள் மற்றும் ஊனமுற்றோரின் பாதுகாவலர்களைக் கொண்டவர்கள். CEJ சார்பாக திரு.பாலசுப்ரமணியம் திருச்செந்தூரன், திரு.ரோஹன குமார, திரு.திலேன பத்ரகொட மற்றும் திருமதி.சலனி ரூபசிங்க ஆகியோர் கலந்துரையாடலில் கலந்துகொண்டனர்.

🇮🇷 #Iran

Joint Statement: We urge the UN Human Rights Council  to hold a special session on Iran urgently - to independently investigate, report and hold accountable the grave violations of human rights under international law amidst protests and crackdowns on WHRDs. 

The recent protests were sparked by outrage at the death in custody of Mahsa (Jina) Amini, a 22 year old woman from the Kurdish minority, on 16 September 2022 days after being arrested by the "morality" police for not complying with the country's discriminatory and abusive compulsory veiling laws, which perpetuate violence against women and girls in Iran and strip them of their right to dignity and bodily autonomy. The focus of the protests has since quickly expanded to broader grievances and encompassed demands for fundamental political and social change towards protection and fulfillment of human rights. 

The United Nations Human Rights Council should act as a matter of urgency by holding a special session and -- given the gravity of crimes under international law and other serious human rights violations committed in Iran and the prevailing systemic impunity -- establish an independent, investigative, reporting and accountability mechanism. 

https://www.frontlinedefenders.org/en/statement-report/joint-statment-iran-un-human-rights-council-must-hold-special-session-on-iran

IESC’s USDA-funded Trade Safe (TraSa) project in the Dominican Republic held a post-harvest and cold chain workshop with ProDominicana in Santiago for agricultural producers, packers, merchants, and other actors in the production chain. IESC and ProDominicana delivered training on legal standards and best practices in pre-harvest, harvest, and post-harvest, as well as food safety and cold chain management. Workshops like these build capacity for each stage of perishable goods processing to help ensure the cold chain is maintained from harvest through export. Front Line Defenders is deeply concerned about the two-year detention, conviction and judicial harassment of the human rights defender Tony Germain Nkina. We believe that he is being targeted solely as a result of his past peaceful and legitimate work in defence of human rights.

13 October 2022 marks two years of his detention. On 13 October 2020, he was arrested without a warrant in Kabarore where he was visiting a client for his professional work as a lawyer.

Tony Nkina is a well known human rights lawyer in Kayanza province who provides legal assistance to detained persons and victims of human rights abuses. He is the former representative of the Association for the Protection of Human Rights and Detained Persons (Association pour la protection des droits humains et des personnes détenues, APRODH), a leading human rights group in Burundi until 2015. In 2015 the government suspended the organization as part of a crackdown on independent civil society.

In June 2021, a court in Kayanza found Tony Nkina guilty of collaboration with armed groups – a common accusation against perceived opponents and critics in Burundi – and sentenced him to five years in prison. The human rights defender’s lawyer immediately filed an appeal the Court of Appeal of Ngozi on 16 July 2021. His lawyer reports that Tony Germain Nkina was questioned regarding APRODH. The human rights defender and lawyer was found guilty of complicity with armed groups and sentenced to five years’ imprisonment and a fine of one million Burundian francs. 

 Front Line Defenders call on the Burundian authorities to quash the sentence upheld by the appeal court of Ngozi and unconditionally release Tony Germain Nkina. We  encourage the Burundian authorities to guarantee in all circumstances that all human rights defenders in Burundi are able to carry out their legitimate human rights activities without fear of reprisals and free of all restrictions.

This Global Entrepreneurship Week, IESC highlights the USAID-funded youth employment and entrepreneurship project, YouLead’s, completion of 276 separate village-level Entrepreneurship Development training programs in collaboration with the Department of Samurdhi Development, Sri Lanka's poverty alleviation agency. The programs reached 13,647 micro and small business owners, providing them with entrepreneurship skills and enabling them to launch or improve their businesses.
 
"With COVID related travel restrictions, I realized that I had to build my customer base online," says Ayo Fashions' owner, 31-year-old Gayani, a determined young micro entrepreneur from Padiyathalawa. Gayani was one of the participants who attended the Entrepreneurship Development (ED) training sessions, which focused on self-employment and microenterprise development. After two years, Gayani wanted to take her business to the next level and improve her understanding of costing, financial management, branding, and marketing, prompting her to enroll in YouLead's ED training program. After completing her training, Gayani registered her business and sourced clothing tags with the brand name. The training provided her with tips and tools to improve her online presence and marketing efforts. As a result, Gayani's micro-business thrived despite COVID and Sri Lanka's socio-economic upheaval.

Global Entrepreneurship Week celebrates and empowers entrepreneurs around the world – especially those individuals who face structural barriers. Through the ED training sessions, IESC supported micro-business owners like Gayani. As a result, they push the boundaries of conventional business thinking, adopt new skills to meet current economic challenges, and are better equipped to sustain their businesses in the long term. YouLead recognizes the importance of developing rural women entrepreneurs and the vital role they can play in uplifting their families and contributing to the national economy. #GEW2022

The Dublin Arts and Human Rights Festival launches this Friday, 14th October:

The Dublin Arts and Human Rights Festival is an annual, international festival organised by Smashing Times International Centre for the Arts and Equality and Front Line Defenders. This year’s festival runs from the 14 – 23 October, with the theme ‘In Solidarity: A Celebration of Human Rights’.

The festival aims to promote human rights and justice for all, and the vision of a world where all people are treated equally, with dignity and respect – linking the arts to civil society, active citizenship and politics. The extraordinary work of human rights defenders in Ireland and around the world, past and present, and the role of the arts in promoting human rights will be showcased and highlighted at the festival, aiming to celebrate and unite community connections, artists, human rights organisations and human rights defenders.

The festival will showcase world-class and diverse acts, artists and speakers, including up and coming performers. It brings arts and human rights together through interdisciplinary events which include workshops, theatre performances, musical performances, visual arts, exhibitions, film screenings, panel discussions, poetry and literature events, historical memory performances, live art, digital installations, and more. 

See the full program here and book your tickets early!

https://www.frontlinedefenders.org/en/campaign/dublin-arts-human-rights-festival-2022

Are you passionate about gaming, animation, and the power of social media? Mogo Studios, a cutting-edge game development and animation studio, is on the lookout for a dynamic and creative Social Media Executive to join our team! If you thrive in a fast-paced, innovative environment and have a knack for engaging audiences, we want to hear from you.

Job Description:
- Develop a LinkedIn content strategy, including thought leadership articles and posts for the Mogo management
- Publish engaging content on all other Mogo Games & Mogo Studios social media platforms (Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, TikTok).
- Create captivating content that aligns seamlessly with the distinctive branding of Mogo Games and Mogo Studios.
- Monitor and respond to audience inquiries.
- Stay updated on emerging digital media trends and incorporate them into our strategy.

Requirements:
- Minimum 1-year experience in social media management and content writing.
- Proficiency in various social media platforms (LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, TikTok).
- Ability to multitask and collaborate effectively with multiple teams.
- Excellent command of English with strong communication skills.
- Knowledge of Canva, Adobe Premiere, Photoshop, or similar editing software is an advantage.
- Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with meticulous attention to detail.

Send us your resume and a brief introduction to games@mogo.lk. Feel free to showcase your creativity by including samples of your social media, and especially LinkedIn, content!

පරිසරය රකින්න ගියාම විවිධ චෝදනා එන එක සාමාන්‍ය දෙයක්. ඕනම දේකට පක්ෂ විපක්ෂ කණ්ඩායම් දෙකක් ඉන්න පුළුවන්.බුද්ධිමත්ව හිතන්න පුළුවන් බෞද්ධයන් මෙය තේරුම් ගනීවි යැයි  සිතනවා.   බුදුන් විසින් දේශනා කරන ලද විකෘති නොකළ පිරිසිදු  ධර්මය පමණක් අවබෝධයෙන් අදහන පුද්ගලයෙක්  ලෙස ලියමි . කඳු මුදුන් මත හා පර්වත මුදුනේ චෛත්‍යය නිර්මාණය කිරීම මේ වන විට බෞද්ධ සමාජයේ රැල්ලක් වී ඇත ඒ සඳහා කොටසක් විවිධ මත ඉදිරිපත් කරති.ආරක්ෂා කළ යුතු කන්දු මුදුන් මත චෛත්‍ය,පන්සල්, පල්ලි, කෝවිල් හා හෝටල්, කුළුණු ආදී සියලු දේ ඉදිකිරීම නොකළ යුතු බව අවධාරණය කර සිටිමු.නෙල්ලිගලින්, කූරගලින්, නාරංගලින් ඇරඹි මෙම රැල්ල අද වන විට හන්තාන,බතලේගල ,ඇතුළු කඳු මුදුන් මතටද යොමු වී ඇත.පන්සලක් පල්ලියක් හෝ කෝවිලක් නිර්මාණය විය යුත්තේ පුද්ගලයෙකුට පහසුවෙන් වන්දනාමාන කර ගත හැකි ස්ථානයකය.මෙම නිර්මාණ මගින් බලාපොරොත්තු වන්නේ පුරවැසියන්ගේ ගුණ ධර්ම වැඩි දියුණු කිරීම නම් එය මෙම ඉදිකිරීම් මගින් ඉටු නොවේ.ඒ සඳහා බුදුන් දේශනා කළ පැහැදිලි ධර්මය සමාජගත කිරීම ස්වාමීන් වහන්සේලාගේ යුතුකමකි.මෙවැනි ස්ථානවල චෛත්‍යය නිර්මාණය කිරීම මහත්ඵල ආනිශංස ගෙන දෙන කාරණාවක් ලෙස බුදුන් දේශනා  කර නැත . වෙහෙර විහාරස්ථාන තැනිය යුතුය. එම මතය මම ද අනුමත කරමි. නමුත් අධි සංවේදී පාරිසරික වශයෙන් වැදගත් වැදගත්කමක් උසුලන  ස්තාන මේ සදහා යොදා ගැනීම සුදුසු නොවන කරුණකි. එය කූරගලින් මොනවට පැහැදිලිවේ. අදවනවිට කූරගල අවට පොලිතින් පාරාදීසයකි.  මෙම රැල්ලේ නවතම ඉදිකිරීම ඇරඹුවේ බතලේගලිනි . බතලේගල යනු 
සබරගමු පළාතේ කෑගල්ල  දිස්ත්‍රික්කයේ , අරනායක ප්‍රාදේශීය  ලේකම් කොට්ටාශයේ පිහිටා ඇති  මධ්‍යම කදුකරයේ පරිවාර කඳු ලෙසින්  පිහිටා ඇති . මුහුදු මට්ටලම් සිට අඩි 
2780 ක උසකින් පිහිට ඇති . උතුරින් “උතුවන් කන්ද” දකුණු දෙසින්  ‘සාමසර කන්ද’ ( වනාන්තරය එලි පෙහෙළි  කර තේ  වගාකිරීමෙන් පසු 2017 දී වර්ශාවත් සමග මිනිස් ජිවිත 123 ක අහිමි කරමින්  
නාය ගිය කන්ද ) නැගෙනහිරින් අම්බුලුවාව කන්ද ,බටහිරින් “ඌරාකන්දටද මැදිව පිහිටා ඇත.
පුංචි සීගිරිය, සහ බයිබල් රොක් ලෙසින්ද හදුන්වනු ලබන බතලේගල කන්ද 
මනස්කාන්ත භූදර්ශනයකට උරුමකම්  කියයි  . කෂණිකව වෙනස්  වන කාලගුණය , කදු වැටියේ ගෑවී නොගෑවී යන වලාකුළු හේතුවෙන් මනස්කාන්ත භූදර්ශනයක් පරිසරයට උරුම කරයි ..
ජල ලපෝෂක ප්‍රදේශයක් මෙන්ම  ඉහළ  ජෛව විවිධත්වයක් සහිත බතලේගල ආශිත ප්‍රදේශය  මෙරටට 
ආවේණික  සහ වැදගත්කමක් ඇති ශාක හා සත්ව විශේෂයන්ගෙන්  සමන්විතයි.
ඇටඹ, වල්දෙල්, හල්මිල්ල, බුලු , බෝවිටිය වර්ග, පුස්වැල්, උඩවැඩියා විශේෂ ,ගල් ගොරකා  වැනි ශාකවලින් සහ මෙරටට ආවේණික උරග විශේෂ, පක්ෂීන්  විශේෂ සමනලුන් විශේෂ ,සහ සිවුපා විශේෂ බොහොමයක් මේ ආශ්‍රිතව ජීවත් වනු ලබයි

ස්වභාවධර්මයාගේ නිර්මාණයක් වූ බතලේගල කඳු මුදුන මෙවැනි ඉදිකිරීම් සඳහා කිසිසේත් අනුමත කළ නොහැක. විශේෂයෙන් පිහිටි භූමිය වෙනස් කරමින් සිමෙන්ති භාවිතා කරමින් ගොඩනැගිලි ඉදිකිරීම මෙවැනි සංවේදී නිශ්ශබ්ද පරිසර කලාපයකට යෝග්‍ය නොවේ . ජනතාවගේ පැමිණීම මත  කැලිකසල ස්වභාවික පරිසරයට ඉක්මනින් එකතුවීම (දැඩි සුළඟ හේතුවෙන්),  ජල මූලාශ්‍ර දූෂණය වීම සිදුවේ

ඔබ කොළඹ සිට නුවර දෙසට යන මග කඩුගන්නාව ප්‍රදේශයේ දී දකුණු දෙසින්  දිස්වන්නේ මනරම් වූ බතලේගල කන්දයි . අධිකරණ නියෝගයක් මගින් කඩුගන්නාවේ මෙම භූ දර්ශනයට බාධාවක් වන ලෙස පැවැති කඩ සහ billboard ඉවත් කරනු ලැබුවේ මෙම මනරම්  වූ භූ දර්ශනය ජනතාවට පැහැදිලිව දැකගැනීමටය  නමුත් බතලේගල කන්ද මුදුනේ මෙවැනි ඉදිකිරීමක් සිදුවුවහොත් එම භූ දර්ශනය වෙනස් වීම  අනිවාර්යයෙන් සිදුවේ . ඔබ සිතන්න භූ දර්ශනයක ඡායාරූපයක් ගත් කල කොහේ හෝ කොනක කඳු මුදුනක කුළුණක් හෝ යම් ඉදිකිරීමක් ඇත. ඒ වෙනුවෙන් පවතින නීතිය ජාතික පාරිසරික පනතේ  16 (d) වගන්තියේ පැහැදිලිව දක්වා ඇත. එය ක්‍රියාත්මක කිරීම මද්‍යම පරිසර අධිකාරියේ වගකීමකි. 

මෙම වරදට වගකිවයුත්තේ රාජ්‍ය නිලධාරීන්ය. ඔවුන් පරිසර නීතිය පිලිබද වැහීමෙන් කටයුතු කලේනම් මෙම ගැටලුව පැනනගින්නේ නැත. දේශපාලකයන්ගේ  පදයට නටන්න ගිය ප්‍රාදේශීය ලේකම්වරයෙකුගේ වැරදි තීරණයක් මෙයට මූලික වී ඇත. තවද වන සංරක්ෂණ දෙපාර්තමේන්තුවේ පහල නිලධාරීන් අදටත් මෙම කටයුත්ත සාධාරනීකරනය කරති.එය අපටනම් අප්‍රසන්නය. ඔවුන් නීතිය නොදැනිම එයට හේතුවයි . "නීතිය නොදැන සිටීම සමාවට හේතුවක් නොවේ" කියල මතක්කරල දෙන්න කැමතියි .

බෞද්ධයනි ඔබට මෙය වැටහේවා.ස්වාමීන් වහන්ස ඔබ වහන්සේලා මෙය තේරුම් ගනීවි යැයි සිතමි.  මෙය ආගමික ගැටලුවක් නොව පාරිසරික ගැටලුවකි. අප බුදුන් දේශනා කළ පිරිසිදු ධර්මය අදහන බෞද්ධයන් වෙමු. බෞද්ධයන් බුද්ධියෙන් කටයුතු කරනු ඇතැයි සිතමු. යථාර්ථයට මුහුණ දෙමු.  අනාගත දරුවන් වෙනුවෙන් මේ කඳු වැටි හා  පරිසරය සුරකිමු .නැණ ගුණයෙන් සපිරි දැහැමි සමාජයක් බිහි කිරීමට බොහෝ දේ කළ යුතුව ඇත. එවැනි දේට සිත් පහළ වේවා.....!

From October 21 – 28, IESC’s USDA-funded Market-Oriented Dairy (MOD) project worked with its partners at the University of Florida (UF) to bring 12 large dairy farm owners and managers and two government officials from Sri Lanka to visit five large dairy farms in Florida and Georgia, including UF’s research farm. The participants were able to observe the farms in action and speak with the owners about strategies for overcoming challenges as well as best practices related to cow comfort, nutrition, and herd management. IESC will support participants in implementing their key takeaways from the trip to increase milk production and strengthen their businesses. The participants also plan to share these best practices with other dairy entrepreneurs in Sri Lanka. #GEW2022

David and Goliath: Front line communities challenging corporate abuse:

Join us at this exclusive event at the Dublin Arts and Human Rights Festival.

Land grabs, violent evictions, widespread deforestation and destruction of biodiversity, poor working conditions and more, are just some of the negative impacts of corporate abuse-  companies operating with impunity for their human rights violations – companies that grow and process products that we use everyday in Ireland.

Communities around the world are on the front lines of challenging these companies, but sadly, human rights defenders that dare to speak out on these harmful practices risk dangerous retaliation, harassment, threats, attacks and criminalisation, and even murder.

At this event, two international guests – women human rights defenders Grecia Eugenia Rodríguez Navarro from Mexico, and Bidya Shrestha Maharjan from Nepal -will share the realities of what it is like challenging corporate abuse on the ground. Both are working hard to expose, and prevent, corporate-related human rights abuse in their communities, and have faced backlash for their defence of human rights. The event will also include an exclusive screening of the new Trócaire Documentary ‘Make It Your Business’ – a new short documentary which goes on a journey to explore corporate accountability, meeting experts and human rights activists on the front lines of corporate exploitation and abuse, and how we might improve on this in future. To tackle these injustices, the documentary also explores how we might realise a better future by bringing in new 
rules to protect people and planet, and how ordinary people can stand up and take action.

People are vulnerable to increasing environmental pollution and unprecedented economic changes in countries like Sri Lanka. Development projects such as coal power plants have exaggerated the vulnerability of the communities to the threats of environmental pollution coupled with economic crises. This study is to present the concurrent socio-environmental issues related to the largest power plant in Sri Lanka—the Norochcholai coal power plant (NCPP).

By Anuradhi Jayasinghe

On November 9, IESC’s USAID-funded LinkSME project in Vietnam and the Agency for Enterprise Development (AED) organized a training session for business support organizations (BSOs) on evaluating the capacity of small and medium enterprises (SMEs). Thirty participants from ten BSOs learned how to utilize SME assessment-and-auditing tools and handbooks developed by the project and AED, thereby enabling BSOs to confidently identify and introduce an increasing number of qualified SMEs to lead firms as potential suppliers. This kind of training helps BSOs support SMEs without project assistance, leading to a more sustainable supporting environment.

#StoriesOfResettlement: After returning to Batticaloa in 2006, Kokila Devi resettled armed with an MBA in Human Resources from India. However, her plans for a good job opportunity were quashed when she was told she was overqualified by all potential employers. She then turned to her childhood dream of making her own spices. With help from UNDPs SDR programme she was able to get machines to help start up her business 'Naga Pasumai Masala'. She now runs a successful business and received the 'Best Women Entrepreneur' Award and the 'Best Industrialist Award for her efforts. In the next 5 years, she aims to export products and have a factory for her growing venture. 

The Support for Durable Resettlement (SDR) Project supports the resettlement of Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) and refugee returnees, providing them with durable resettlement opportunities including access to essential basic services, sustainable livelihoods and income generation opportunities.

The SDR Project is implemented by the United Nations Development Programme - UNDP in Sri Lanka together with the Government of Sri Lanka, with funding from the British High Commission Colombo, across 4 Districts in #Jaffna, #Kilinochchi, #Mullaitivu and #Trincomalee.

Housing as a Human Right: Stories from the front line 

Housing precariousness has reached an unprecedented scale and worldwide housing is rarely treated as a human right. On the contrary, those people organising and acting to defend and promote this right are often targeted with criminal lawsuits, defamation campaigns and physical attacks.

At this event, we talk to activists at the forefront of housing movements around the world, hear about the obstacles they are facing and the strategies they are using to advance housing rights. 

Panelists include human rights defenders from Cote D’Ivoire, Cape Town, South Africa and Brazil. Yvonne Toba, Cote D’Ivoire is a human rights defender who is well known for her work denouncing corruption, bad governance, impunity and social injustice and is the National Coordinator of Novox Cote d’Ivoire, an organization raising the voice of the voiceless in Cote d’Ivoire by promoting an equal access to justice. Buhle Booi, South Africa,  is the head of political organising at Ndifuna Ukwazi,  an activist organisation and law centre that advocates for access to well-located land and affordable housing for poor and working class families, communities and social movements.  Camila Santos, Brazil, is a woman human rights defender born in a place known as Grota, in the group of favelas that make up the Complexo do Alemão. She is one of the leaders of the fight for housing in the Alemão complex and started to give voice to 1,300 families. In 2015, based on the actions she was already carrying out and the demands of women who arrived, Camila established the collective Women in Action in Alemão (MEAA). Camila was 2021 Front Line Defender’s Award Winner for the Americas.

The USAID Industry-led Skills Development Program officially launched a new partnership with Geo Hospitals, a network of 15 inpatient and 10 outpatient facilities in five regions of Georgia employing over 1,350 doctors and 1,000 nurses. The partnership aims to establish a sustainable postgraduate nursing education system in the Kvemo Kartli and Kakheti regions. This will be achieved by replicating successful specialized training programs that will serve as a basis for upscaling continuous nursing education programs in two of Geo Hospitals' new regional training centers. The focus will be on specialties in high demand from the healthcare industry. The Program was thrilled to host Erin McKee, the Assistant Administrator in USAID’s Bureau for Europe and Eurasia, at the grant signing event with Geo Hospitals.

text:
🇮🇷 #Iran

Joint Statement: we demand an end to the deliberate violence, arrest, threats, and charges against Iranian human rights defenders, journalists, student activists and civil rights actors, especially amongst minority ethnic groups.

Since 18 September 2022, over fifty human rights defenders, in addition to journalists and student activists, have been arrested and arbitrarily detained, some already charged with "acting against national security". The death toll around the country is estimated to have gone beyond one hundred according to some human rights organisations and media outlets. According to the Baloch Activists Campaign on 1 October 2022, at least sixty seven protesters have been killed only in Zahedan, Balouchestan province. The arrests and attacks appear to be aimed at punishing and silencing those protesting for human rights, especially women’s rights, and accountability for the death in Morality Police custody of a 22-year-old young woman, Mahsa (Jina) Amini, while enforcing the country’s discriminatory forced veiling laws. In response to this, several human rights groups have called for the Iranian police and authorities to be held accountable. 

#IranRevolution

Read more:

https://frontlinedefenders.org/en/statement-report/joint-statement-iran-alarm-over-mass-arrests-human-rights-defenders-amidst-protests

On October 20-21, IESC’s USAID LinkSME project and its partners trained 25 Government of Vietnam officials and nearly 50 participants from small and medium enterprises (SMEs) on how to combine blockchain, barcodes, and branding to build credibility in the traceability of their products. Traceability in the supply chain is becoming essential to ensuring compliance with both international trade requirements and the standards of many buyers in global supply chains. This facet of doing business is rapidly becoming just as important as scale, quality, and quantity with these buyers. Through these events, USAID LinkSME is helping to make SMEs more competitive.

The rapidly changing environment in Sri Lanka requires that farmers adopt new practices and techniques to manage risks and increase production, becoming more resilient in the face of climate change. IESC’s USDA-funded Market-Oriented Dairy (MOD) project partnered with the Department of Animal Production and Health (DAPH) and the International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN) to develop a Climate-Smart Dairy model for medium-scale dairy farms in Sri Lanka. The model, which focuses on low-carbon milk production, emission management, and capacity building, was well received during a two-day workshop. In partnership with MOD and IESC, DAPH will take the lead in piloting the proposed model on 20 to 50 farms to ensure its sustainability beyond the life of the project. #climatesmartag #climateresilience

With the support of IESC’s USDA-funded Trade Safe (TraSa) project in the Dominican Republic, a delegation of Dominican border agents participated in an observation tour of customs facilities in Miami, FL and Laredo, TX. Led by partner the World Food Logistics Organization (WFLO), the objective of the tour was to observe the inspection systems and cold chain processing of two major points of entry for perishable goods in the U.S.: Miami International Airport and the border crossing in Laredo, Texas. IESC’s TraSa project sponsored inspectors and supervisors from the Ministry of Industry, Commerce, and MSMEs; Special Port Security Unit (CESEP); Customs; Department of Plant Health; Department of Animal Health; the National Institute of Traffic and Land Transport (INTRANT); Special Airport and Aviation Security Unit (CESAC); Special Land Border Security Unit (CESFRONT); and General Directorate of Medicines, Food, and Health Products (DIGEMAPS) on this tour. With IESC's support, Dominican inspection units are implementing cold chain solutions to improve food quality and safety for consumers during customs processing. #ProyectoTraSa #ProyectoTradeSafe #TraSa #TradeSafe Proyecto Trade Safe

text: On October 14th, 2022, USAID’s youth employment and entrepreneurship project, YouLead, in partnership with Gamma Pizzakraft Lanka (the owner of the Pizza Hut franchise in Sri Lanka) and the Sevalanka Foundation, celebrated the official launch of the first vocational training kitchen, opened at the Technical College in Kuliyapitiya. This training kitchen is the first under the ‘An Equal Slice for Everyone’ initiative, which is funded by a $1.3 million grant from the Yum! Brands Foundation. Through this public private partnership, the initiative will build 28 vocational training kitchens at training centers across Sri Lanka, with two centers dedicated to training youth with disabilities. The program will train more than 2,100 youth annually for a career in the quick service restaurant industry. Upon successful completion of a six-month course, which includes on-the-job training, students will receive a National Vocational Qualification Level 3 certification. IESC will assist in the development of new curricula aligned to global industry best practices, provide training for vocational instructors, and certify learning outcomes. This initiative will not only employ youth and help fund vocational training, but also ensure the training is sustainable and aligned with employer needs.

On September 27, IESC’s USAID LinkSME project in Vietnam visited the factory of SME Ho Quang to support the deployment of a blockchain platform to improve the traceability of its award-winning rice-seed products. Ho Quang is hoping to ensure the traceability of all production activities via blockchain technology to enhance its product’s image and branding. During the field visit, the project trained factory technicians and sales agents on using the blockchain platform and affixing traceable QR codes to the physical product. USAID LinkSME will provide follow-on support to ensure the smooth implementation of the blockchain platform.

In Sri Lanka, one of the most challenging inputs for dairy farmers to find is quality and affordable feed for their cows, a crucial ingredient in boosting milk production. The recent removal of government subsidies made chemical fertilizers one of the most expensive inputs for fodder production in Sri Lanka, impacting the entire agriculture sector. To help ease the effect of this added expense on fodder cultivators, IESC’s USDA-funded Market-Oriented Dairy (MOD) project is launching an applied research collaboration with nine local public and private sector partners. This collaboration will help find effective microorganisms and vermitea technology to reduce chemical fertilizer use in fodder cultivation while maintaining quality crop yields and soil health.

The USAID LinkSME Project, Vietnam’s Agency for Enterprise Development (AED), and Khanh Hoa Province organized a workshop on October 10 for more than 150 local small and medium enterprises (SMEs) from the agriculture, manufacturing, tourism, and service sectors to explain the value and benefits of digital transformation (DX) in increasing competitiveness. SMEs also learned about a step-by-step approach to achieving DX supported by USAID LinkSME, AED, and Khanh Hoa provincial authorities. SMEs, especially those outside of traditional digital hubs, struggle to keep pace with larger competitors in DX. USAID LinkSME supports these SMEs in adopting DX more quickly.

#Palestinian HRD Salah Hammouri is being detained in solitary confinement in inhumane conditions - he is in poor health due to enduring a hunger strike, while enduring conditions which worsen his condition. Reports have indicated that conditions in cell are as follows:

• The cell is dirty
• No air ventilation. Vent-hole is blocked
• Cell is 2x3 square meters
• Metal bed with a 2 cm mattress 
• A primitive toilet in the room
• No shower in room
• No windows (no sunlight)
• Small yellow bulb. 

Punitive measures infringed by Israeli prison administration due to hunger strike:

• Deprivation of salt intake
• Handcuffs on during shower
• Deprivation of personal belongings, including family and children photos, books and note books.
• Total deprivation of outdoor time since 28 September
• No clean underwear
• Deprivation of monthly family visit
• Subjection to punitive fees 

We call for his immediate release and to end his solitary confinement immediately:

https://www.frontlinedefenders.org/en/case/detained-human-rights-defender-salah-hammouri-continues-hunger-strike-while-moved-solitary

Issues updating your application:
1. Follow the step by step guide given in this link - https://www.unfpa.org/sites/default/files/resource-pdf/Quantum%20-%20External%20Application%20Guide%20August%202022%20.pdf 
2. Use an Incognito Browser to prepare the application - https://www.computerworld.com/article/3356840/how-to-go-incognito-in-chrome-firefox-safari-and-edge.html 
3. Clear browser cookies. 
a. Chrome - https://support.google.com/accounts/answer/32050?hl=en&co=GENIE.Platform%3DDesktop
b. Microsoft Edge - https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-edge/delete-cookies-in-microsoft-edge-63947406-40ac-c3b8-57b9-2a946a29ae09
c. Apple Mac - https://support.apple.com/en-lk/guide/safari/sfri11471/mac
4. When preparing the application, save it from time to time. 
5. Make sure to attach a Cover Letter and an updated CV customized to the position. Ensure that you add the dates of employment and qualifications, names and details of employers and academic institutions etc. Please provide details of 4 referees, together with the application. 
6. If the technical issue is not resolved, please call 074-1176752, or email lk-hr@unfpa.org.

🌿 Our partner, Centre For Environmental Justice (CEJ) in #SriLanka, organized a training program for Environmental Human Rights Defenders (EHRDs) as part of the "P.E.A.C.E Rights" project. 🤝 

Supported by the European Union in Sri Lanka and the Maldives 🇪🇺 ,the training occurred on June 24th-25th, 2023, at the Vijayawickrama Hotel in Maha Oya. Nineteen participants from Pollebedda and Niloba areas of Eastern Province attended, including 10 females and 9 males. 

During the two-day program, topics covered included:
✅ Defining territories and understanding environmental struggles. 
✅ Identifying environmental and human rights. 
✅ Addressing violence against women and men in environmental struggles. 
✅ Analyzing campaign elements and conducting SWOT analysis. 
✅ Building campaign power and tracking progress. 
✅ Addressing risks faced by EHRDs in environmental issues. 
✅ Understanding the judicial systems in Sri Lanka. 
✅ Developing a rapid response system for defense. 
✅ Role of men and women in campaigning. 
✅ Networking and campaigning for environmental issues.

The P.E.A.C.E – Rights project (Protecting, Empowering Activists & Communities to Enhance Rights) is a new initiative launched in April 2023, led by Diakonia in Sri Lanka, Centre For Environmental Justice and the International Centre for Ethnic Studies 🌍 It aims to connect diverse civil society organizations (CSOs) to create foundations for a broad alliance of #humanrights groups. 🤝✨

The USAID Industry-led Skills Development Program officially launched new partnerships with the Georgian Vocational Skills Agency and UN Women Georgia during a memorandum of understanding signing ceremony on October 3. The theme of the signing ceremony, “Promoting Gender-Inclusive Business Practices in Georgia’s Skills Ecosystem,” centered the discussion on how the private sector can contribute to effective industry-relevant skills development programs that provide all jobseekers, regardless of gender, with the skills they need to obtain high-value employment.

Women's Participation in Politics, Business, Education, Administration, etc must be encouraged. But this needs to be done systematically and strategically by empowering women. Creation of spaces for women if done haphazardly will result in women "breaking the glass ceiling" yet failing to "navigate the glass cliff". This ultimately results in more labels against women further curtailing their space and opportunity. We need to have "right women at right places". 

With the pressure from governments, International Organisations, SDGs, availability of recognition and funding for women's movement many organisations and institutions pay lip service to the rightful empowerment and promotion of women. This rather helping them, does a larger damage. 

#Gender #glasscliff #glassceiling #empowe #women

Susil Sirivardana (1938-2021)

We are saddened by the loss of Mr Susil Sirivardana. His passion,  commitment and contribution to poverty alleviation and housing programmes as well as his pursuit of participatory, pro poor development approaches have left a mark in Sri Lanka. We at CEPA are grateful for the opportunities we had to interact with Mr Sirivardana. We had the opportunity to learn from his vast experience, and at times he would push us and encourage us to take action. His support  for our work especially on issues related to urban poverty and housing is much valued. 

We offer our condolences to his family and colleagues.

Global Legal Action Network and Front Line Defenders are deeply concerned over the repeated targeting of human rights defenders resisting destructive private luxury tourism developments in Barbuda. A group of human right defenders inspecting one of the contested construction sites on the island have been charged with unlawful trespass. One of the most effective tools IESC’s USDA-funded Market-Oriented Dairy (MOD) project in Sri Lanka employs is Farmer Group Discussions. These discussions allow a lead farmer to share their experience in applying a particular best practice with other farmers to relay the benefits they have experienced from implementation. After attending a Farmer Group Discussion on total mixed ration (TMR) feeding, Ms. Seetharanjini was convinced to apply the practice on her farm. With IESC’s support, she has doubled her milk production from 6 to 12 liters per day since doing so.

In 2021, meriem was charged with ''knowingly harming or disturbing others via public telecommunications networks” and sentenced her to four months’ imprisonment and a fine of 500 dinars. 

This was because of a Facebook post where she criticized the violence exerted by the police against civilians which included a video that documented an assault by a security officer. 

Tomorrow, she is due to attend an appeal hearing session in front of the Sfax Court of Appeal. we call for all charges against her to be dropped immediately.

🇧🇾 #Belarus

On 22 September 2022, Frunze District Court in Misnk sentenced woman human rights defender Nasta Loika to another 15 days administrative arrest on “petty hooliganism” charges, a violation under Article 19.1 of the Code of Administrative Offences. On 21 September 2022, her colleagues reported that she was not released from detention. On 7 September 2022, Nasta Loika was already sentenced to 15 days of administrative arrest on the same charges.

Nasta Loika is a prominent Belarusian WHRD working in the field of human rights education. She also addresess repressive “anti-extremist” laws, and advocates for the protection of the migrants and stateless people rights in Belarus. In the summer of 2021, Belarusian authorities shut down the organisation where Nasta Loika previously worked for - Human Constanta - which promoted public interests and joint actions in response to modern challenges in the field of human rights, as a part of an orchestrated attack against the civil society in the country.

On 22 September 2022, Frunze District Court in Misnk sentenced Nasta Loika to another 15-days administrative arrest on “petty hooliganism” charges. She was not present in court, and did not have access to her lawyer, as the court denied the motion to invite  attorney. The only person who was invited to be present during the hearing was a law enforcement officer. According to his testimony, the law enforcement officers were informed about Nasta Loika’s participation in public protests and they needed to question her about her involvement.

Front Line Defenders is gravely concerned about the lack of information on the whereabouts of woman human rights defender Nasta Loika and calls upon the Belarusian authorities to immediately release her from detention. Front Line Defenders believes that the woman human rights defender is being repeatedly targeted for her peaceful human rights work. Her earlier arrest is part of the increasing attacks against Belarus's human rights defenders and civil society by Belarusian authorities.  

https://frontlinedefenders.org/en/case/woman-human-rights-defender-nasta-loika-sentenced-another-15-days-administrative-arrest

Curious to know what IESC’s Farmer-to-Farmer (F2F) program has accomplished in the past 2+ years? F2F has been providing support to agricultural organizations abroad through a paired remote volunteer model, matching up a U.S.-based volunteer expert and one national volunteer expert to take on a short-term assignment. IESC’s F2F focus on increasing access to finance in Kenya, Tanzania, and Sri Lanka has allowed many women and youth farmers to obtain financing to strengthen their livelihoods. Watch the video to learn more about one assignment completed by U.S. volunteer expert Katherine Cassidy and Tanzania volunteer expert Ernest Jerome, who worked with a microfinance institution in Zanzibar that provides loans, particularly to women and smallholder farmers. http://ow.ly/H90o50KXg6B #F2F

International Human Rights Day 2022
Dignity, Freedom, and Justice for All

Dr. Sakuntala Kadirgamar
Executive Director
Law and Society Trust

Today, the 10th of December is Human Rights Day and today, as in the past the United Nations, governments, and civil society the world over will commemorate it.

the theme is the danger that we make ritual commemorations and as the day passes, everyone forgets about making this a living reality.

This year, the theme focuses on Dignity, Freedom, and Justice for all and we must ask ourselves what these words mean to us in Sri Lanka today.

Our economy and society have been ravaged by covid and an economic crisis that has thrown many people into poverty and the prospects of recovery are uncertain if not bleak. Our government is focusing on balancing the books and on economic indicators but less attention is paid to human development indicators. There is a rise in malnutrition, food insecurity, and the prospects of children ruined through disruptions in education.

Covid has provided the cover for governments the world over to clamp down on civil rights, freedoms of movement, association, and even free speech where people criticized government responses to covid.

In Sri Lanka, we continue to struggle against the Prevention of Terrorism Act – a draconian law enabling arbitrary arrests and detention for alleged terrorist activities that are vaguely defined. It has been arbitrarily used against minorities and is now expanded for use against political opponents of governments.

Justice for all remains elusive in Sri Lanka where the Rule of Law does not operate. Those with political power and patronage enjoy impunity and are not held accountable for corruption, abuse of power, and even murder. Post-war claims for accountability for war crimes, information on missing persons, and restitution of lands and livelihoods remain unaddressed.

We must ask ourselves: Are we committed to ensuring Dignity, Freedom, and Justice for All in the coming year or will this be another ritual commemoration?

ආචාර්‍ය සකුන්තලා කදිර්ගාමර් 
විධායක අධ්‍යක්ෂිකා,
නීතිය හා සමාජ භාරය.

අද දෙසැම්බර් 10 වැනිදා. ලෝක මානව හිමිකම් දිනය. අතීතයේ පසුවූ සෑම දෙසැම්බර් 10 වනිදාවක් වගේම අදත්, එක්සත් ජාතීන්ගේ සංවිධානය, ලොව පුරා අනිකුත් රාජ්‍යයන් වගේම සිවිල් සමාජයත්  මේ මානව හිමිකම් දිනය සමරනවා. කලක් තිස්සේම මානව හිමිකම් දිනය අපි චාරිත්‍රානුකුලව සමරනවා වුනත්, මානව හිමිකම් යනු සජීවී යථාර්තයක් බවට පත්කර ගත යුත්තක් යැයි අපටම අමතකවී තිබෙන බවක් හඳුනා ගත හැකියි.
2022 වසරේ ලෝක මානව හිමිකම් තේමාව ලෙස "සැමට අභිමානය, නිදහස සහ යුක්තිය" යන සංකල්පය නම්කොට තිබෙනවා. නමුත් ලාංකිකයින් විදිහට, මේ වචන වල අර්ථයන් අපට අදාළ වන්නේ කෙසේදැයි අපි අපෙන්ම අසාගත යුතුයි. 
COVID -19 වසංගතයේ බලපෑමෙන් සහ ආර්ථික අර්බුධය හේතුවෙන් අප සමාජය ව්‍යාකුලත්වයට පත්වූවා සේම බොහෝ මිනිසුන් දරිද්‍රතාවයට ඇද දැමූ බව නොරහසක්. මේ සියල්ල යථා තත්වයට පත්වෙතැයි වන අපේක්ෂාව පවා අඳුරු සහ අවිනිශ්චිත තත්වයක පවතිනවා. අපේ රජය ආර්ථික දර්ශක සහ ඉලක්කම් සමතුලිත කිරීමට වෙහෙසෙන නමුත් මානව දර්ශකය පිලිබඳ, මිනිසුන්ගේ පැවැත්ම පිලිබඳ අවදානය යොමුකරන බවක් පෙන්නේන්නට නැහැ. මන්දපෝෂණය, ආහාර සුරක්ෂිතතාව නොමැති වීම වගේම අධ්‍යාපනය අඩාල වීම නිසා දරුවන්ගේ අනාගතය අවිනිශ්චිත තත්වයට පත්වීමේ වැඩිවීමක් දක්නට තිබෙනවා. COVID - 19 සඳහා රජය දක්වන ප්‍රතිචාරයන්  පිළිබඳව වූ විවේචනයන් වගේම සිවිල් අයිතිවාසිකම්, ගමන් කිරීමේ සහ එක්රැස් වීමේ නිදහස, භාෂණයේ නිදහස පවා සීමා කිරීමට රාජ්‍යයන්ට COVID - 19 වසංගතය විසින් මාවතක් සකසා දී තිබුණා. 
නොපැහැදිලි ලෙස අර්ථ දක්වා තිබෙන "ත්‍රස්තවාදී ක්‍රියාකාරකම්" හේතුවෙන් අත්තනෝමතික ලෙස අත්අඩංගුවට ගැනීමට සහ රඳවා තබා ගැනීමට නෛතික වරප්‍රසාද සපයන කුරිරු නීතියක් වන "ත්‍රස්තවාදය වැළක්වීමේ පනත"ට එරෙහිව ශ්‍රී ලාංකිකයින් ලෙස අපි දිගින් දිගටම අරගල කරමින් සිටිනවා. එම නීතිය සුළු ජාතීන්ට එරෙහිව අත්තනෝමතික ලෙස භාවිතා කර තිබෙනවා මෙන්ම, දැන් දැන් ආණ්ඩුවල ක්‍රියාකාරකම් ප්‍රසිද්ධියේ විවේචනය කරන දේශපාලන විරුද්ධවාදීන්ට එරෙහිව ක්‍රියාත්මක කළ හැකි පරිදි සංශෝධනය කොට තිබෙනවා. 
නීතියේ ස්වාධිපත්‍ය ක්‍රියාත්මක නොවන ශ්‍රී ලංකාව වැනි රටක "සැමට යුක්තිය": අපේක්ෂා කළ නොහැක්කක්. දේශපාලන බලය සහ අනුග්‍රහය සහිත පාර්ශවයන් දණ්ඩමුක්තිය බුක්ති විඳිනවා මෙන්ම, දුෂණයේ, බලය අවභාවිත කිරීමේ සහ මිනීමැරීමේ චෝදනාවන්ට පවා දඬුවම් විඳීමකින් තොරව නිදහස ලබනවා. යුධ අපරාධ සම්බන්ධයෙන් යුක්තිය පසිඳලීම හෝ අතුරුදන් වූවන් පිළිබඳ තොරතුරු ලබාදීම, ඉඩම් සහ ජීවනෝපාය මාර්ගයන් නැවත ලබාදීම වැනි කිසිවක් ඉටුකිරීමට මෙතෙක් රජයන්ට හැකියාවක් ලැබී නැහැ.
ජාත්‍යන්තර මානව හිමිකම් දිනය සමරන අද දවසේදී අප අපෙන්ම අසාගත යුතු එක ප්‍රශ්නයක් තිබෙනවා. මෙවැනි පසුබිමක සිට ඉදිරි වසර තුළ සැමට අභිමානය, නිදහස සහ යුක්තිය සහතික කරවීමට අප කැපවී සිටිනවාද, නැතහොත් මෙය තවත් සාම්ප්‍රදායික චාරිත්‍රානුකූල සැමරුමක් පමණක්ම වේද..??

IESC’s USAID LinkSME project in Vietnam supported Ho Chi Minh City’s Center of Supporting Industry Development to organize the Sourcing Fair Supporting Industries 2022 on September 8-9. This event connected 100 SMEs in the supporting industries sector to 20 foreign investors and international lead firms and facilitated 200 meetings both online and on-site. The promise of potential international linkages will spur participating SMEs to improve their production processes to meet the quantity, quality, and consistency demands of lead firms, thereby increasing both their competitiveness and the likelihood of increasing Vietnamese SMEs’ participation in the global economy.

More than 11 years on from his brutal arrest and 9 years after the WGAD opinion, Abdulhadi Al-Khawaja remains behind bars in Jau prison in Bahrain. 

In a January 2021 phone call, the human rights defender listed four concerns including that prison authorities had placed restrictions on his phone calls with family (that have replaced their in-person visits) and had confiscated hundreds of his books and other materials. The defender continues to suffer from chronic pain as a result of the mistreatment he endured in the early days of his detention, and requires additional medical intervention as his facial bone structure remains permanently damaged. Prison authorities continue to arbitrarily deny him adequate healthcare and refuse to refer him to specialists for the surgeries he requires. Denying a prisoner needed medical care violates the United Nations Standard Minimum Rules for the Treatment of Prisoners, known as the Nelson Mandela Rules. 

We urgently call on the #Bahrain government to #FreeAlKhawaja and support the call of the Danish government to free him immediately.

On September 15, 2022, the Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation’s (SDC) Skilled and Resilient Migrant Workers project (SRMW), implemented by IESC, held a public-private dialogue on building a more skilled migrant workforce in Sri Lanka. The dialogue included a group of 32 stakeholders, including relevant government and ministry representatives, donor agencies, training institutions, employment agencies, and non-governmental and multilateral development partners. the dialogue challenged them to come together to support prospective migrant workers with better information and skills. As priority next steps, the dialogue identified the need to strengthen skills certification through the recognition of prior learning (RPL) process, to implement key policy recommendations related to increasing skilled labor migration, and to improve soft skills training opportunities. IESC will hold focused workshops on these areas to develop rapid interventions with stakeholders for implementation. The goals for this collaboration are to improve the quality of and access to information, occupational guidance, and opportunities for skills development for prospective migrant workers in a timely manner, in order to minimize negative impacts and maximize the positive impacts of overseas work. Achieving these goals will ensure that when overseas migrant workers return to Sri Lanka, they do so with skills and knowledge that will contribute to the country’s continued growth. 

Pictured here, Mr. R. P. A. Wimalaweera, Secretary to the Ministry of Labor and Foreign Employment, is making opening remarks at the dialogue.

Former Middle East and North Africa (MENA) Protection Coordinator for Front Line Defenders, former President of the Bahrain Centre for Human Rights (BCHR) and co-founder of Gulf Centre for Human Rights (GCHR), Abdulhadi Al-Khawaja has a long history of working to promote human rights in the MENA region and championing the protection of human rights defenders at risk. 

In February 2011 protests and demonstrations broke out across Bahrain calling for greater political freedoms. As part of the government’s crackdown on these protests, opposition leaders and leading human rights defenders, including Abdulhadi Al-Khawaja were arrested. 

On 9 April 2011, up to twenty armed and masked policemen broke into the Al-Khawaja family home in the middle of the night, dragged Abdulhadi Al-Khawaja down the stairs even though he agreed to go peacefully, and extensively beat him, including repeatedly kicking his head. Following his arrest he required a 4 hour surgery on his face and jaw, injuries that continue to cause him pain 10 years on.

On 22 June 2011, Abdulhadi Al-Khawaja was sentenced to life imprisonment on charges of “organising and managing a terrorist organisation”, “attempts to overthrow the government by force and in liaison with a terrorist organisation working for a foreign country” and the “collection of money for a terrorist group” .

To this day he remains in prison.

Abdul-Hadi Al-Khawaja is a dual Danish-Bahraini citizen, and one of the most prominent democracy and human rights defenders in the Gulf region. Over three decades, he has fought peacefully for social justice, human rights, and pro-democratic changes in Bahrain. He is the co-founder and former director of several human rights organizations, and he has received numerous awards for his activism and work.  
 
In 2011, Al-Khawaja was sentenced to life in prison for his involvement in peaceful protests in Bahrain. During his arrest and time in prison, Al-Khawaja has been brutally tortured and subjected to solitary confinement. As a result of his treatment, Al-Khawaja is in dire need of medical attention and rehabilitation. As of this moment, Al-Khawaja is being denied all access to medical treatment and we’re very worried about his health.

IESC’s USDA-funded Trade Safe (TraSa) project (Proyecto Trade Safe) held the first graduation ceremony for our food safety training program in San Juan de la Maguana, Dominican Republic. Together with local partner CEDAF and family-owned P&T Valley Farms, IESC celebrated 22 producers for completing their first farmer field school (FFS) in Food Safety Modernization Act (FSMA) readiness training. This training program ensures the fresh produce exported from DR follows health and food safety regulations required for entrance into US markets through the Produce Safety Alliance (PSA) Grower Training Course. 

Grower Juan Sanchez expressed the following as a result of his participation in the FFS: “At the Farmer Field School, we learned about the importance of knowing and respecting the pesticide application/harvest intervals for the safety of the consumers of our vegetables. We used to apply pesticides even up to the day before harvest! Now we understand that the type, amount, and when we apply pesticides is critical from a food safety and environmental protection standpoint.” 

Following the FFS, P&T Valley Farms saw a 68% increase in the FSMA Produce Safety Rule knowledge of their producers. 

#ProyectoTraSa #ProyectoTradeSafe #TraSa #TradeSafe

The USAID Industry-led Skills Development Program, implemented by IESC and in partnership with grantees the Agricultural University of Georgia and Caucasus University, promotes the international recognition of Georgian cuisine to encourage increased tourism. The goal of this initiative is to create new educational programs in gastronomy that apply a learn-by-doing approach through the development of demand-driven courses and the provision of required training equipment. These new programs will equip university classrooms with modern technology, methods, and tools to help Georgia become a major destination for culinary travel.

Additionally, with Program support, grantee the Georgian Hospitality Management Institute is working to create a multi-faceted hospitality and tourism training program that will contribute to the transformation of the hospitality industry’s quality standards and promote tourism in Georgia. #RethinkTourism #WTD2022

මුහුදු කැස්බෑ දිනය (ජුනි 16) උදෙසා තබන සටහනකි.
===================================
කැස්බෑ සංරක්ෂණය වෙනුවෙන්  දිවියම කැප කළ “මුහුදු කැස්බෑ ජීව විද්‍යාවේ පියා” Dr. Archie Carr ගේ උපන් දිනය ලෝක කැස්බෑ සංරක්ෂණ දිනය ලෙස නම් කර ඇත. 2000 වසරේ සිට වාර්ෂිකව සෑම ජුනි 16 වෙනිදා දිනකම සැමරෙන ලෝක මුහුදු කැස්බෑ දිනයේ (World Sea Turtle Day) අරමුණ වී ඇත්තේ මුහුදු කස්බෑවන්ගේ වැදගත්කම සහ මුහුණ දෙන තර්ජනවලින්  ඔවුන් ආරක්ෂා කිරීම සඳහා ගෝලීය ප්‍රජාව දිරිමත් කිරීමයි. 

කැස්බෑවන් ගෝලීය වශයෙන් මෙන්ම දේශීය වශයෙන්ද වඳ වීමේ තර්ජනයට ලක් වූ විශේෂයක් ලෙස හදුනාග ගත හැකිය.කැස්බෑවුන් මිහිතලයේ ජිවත් වන ඉපැරණිම ජිව විශේෂයක් ලෙස සැලකිය හැකිය.අවුරුදු 80-120 තරම් කාලයක ආයුෂ විදින කැස්බෑවුන් ,කැස්බෑ දඩයම් කිරීම,වෙරළාශ්රිත අවිධිමත් සංවර්ධනයන් ,කාලගුණ විපර්යාස සහ සමුද්ර දුෂණය හේතුවෙන් තර්ජනයට ලක්ව ඇත.මුහුදු කැස්බෑවන් දේශීය වශයෙන් තර්ජිත (EN) සහ ගෝලීය වශයෙන් දැඩි ලෙස තර්ජිත (CR) මට්ටමේ සිටිනා විශේෂයකි.

ලෝකයෙහි කැස්බෑවුන් විශේෂ 7ක් ජිවත් වේ.එනම්,
01. දාර කැස්බෑවා - Leatherback Turtle 
02. ඔලුගෙඩි කැස්බෑවා - Loggerhead Turtle
03. ලෙලි/පොතු කැස්බෑවා - Hawksbill Turtle
04. බටු කැස්බෑව - Oliver Ridley Turtle
05.කෙම්ප්ගේ ඩේලි කැස්බෑවා - Kemp's Ridley Turtle
06. කොළ/මඩ කැස්බෑවා - Green Turtle 
07. ගල් කැස්බෑවා - Flatback Turtle 
මෙම කැස්බෑවුන් විශේෂ 7 න් විශේෂ 5ක්ම ශ්රී ලංකාවේදී නිරීක්ෂණය කල හැකිය. 

ශ්රී ලංකාවේ දක්නට ලැබෙන විශේෂ 05 :

01. ඔලුගෙඩි කැස්බෑවා (Loggerhead Sea Turtle)
02.කොළ (හරිත) කැස්බෑවා (Green Sea Turtle)
03.පොතු/ලෙලි කැස්බෑවා (hawksbill Sea Turtle)
04.බටු /මඩ කැස්බෑවා (Olive Ridley Sea Turtle) 
05.දාර කැස්බෑවා/තුන්දාර කැස්බෑවා (Leatherback Sea Turtle)

01. Leatherback Sea Turtle ( දාර කැස්බෑවා ) 

• Scientific name - Dermochelys coriacea
• Family - Dermochelidae
• Conservation status - Vulnerable ( අන්තර්ජාතික IUCN රතු දත්ත වාර්තාවට අනුව)

Leatherback Sea Turtle හෙවත් දාර කැස්බෑවා තර්ජනයට පාත්රී කැස්බෑ විශේෂයක් ලෙස හදුනාගත හැකි අතර කැස්බෑ විශේෂ සියල්ලක්ම අතරින් විශාලතම ශරීරයට මොවුන් හිමිකම් කියයි. තද අලු පැහැයට හුරු කලු පැහැයෙන් යුක්ත වන , සුදු පැහැ පැල්ලම් සහ ලප විසිරී ඇති පෘෂ්ඨයකින් සමන්විතය.දාර කැස්බෑවුන්ගේ අස්ථිමය කවචයක් නොපිහිටන අතර ඒ වෙනුවට මේදමය නම්යශීලී සමක් ඇත. එහි ලාක්ෂණික දාර තුනක් පිහිටීම නිසා මොවුන් දාර කැස්බෑවුන් හෙවත් තුන් දාර කැස්බෑවුන් ලෙස හඳුන්වයි. 

දාර කැස්බෑවුන් අත්ලන්තික්, පැසිෆික් හා ඉන්දියන් සාගර ආශ්රිතව දැකගත හැකිය. ශ්රී ලංකාව ආශ්රිත මුහුදේ බහුලව මොවුන් හදුනාගත හැකිය.මොවුන්ගේ සුලභ වාසස්ථාන වන්නේ ගැඹුරු මුහුද ආශ්රිත වෙරල තීරයන්ය.ඉන්දියන් සාගරය ආශ්රිතව සිටින දාර කැස්බෑවුන් ඉන්දියන් සාගරය ආශ්රිත උප ජනගහනයක් ලෙස හැඳින්වේ. 

02. Hawksbill sea turtle (පොතු කැස්බෑවා )

• Scientific Name - Eretmochelys imbricata
• Conservation state - critically endangered

මොවුන් ලෝක සංරක්ෂණ සංගමය විසින් බරපතල තර්ජනයට ලක්ව ඇතැයි (Critically endangered) සැලකෙන මුහුදු කැස්බෑ විශේෂයක් වේ.මොවුන් "පොතු කැස්බෑවා " ලෙස සිංහල ව්යවහාරයේ හදුන්වනු ලබන අතර, හිසේ කෙලවර පිහිටි කුරුල්ලෙකු ගේ හොටක් මෙන් වූ සාපේක්ෂව කුඩා,පටු වූ හොට නිසා මොවුන් ට "Hawksbill" යන ඉංග්රීසී නාමය ලැබී ඇත.රතු පැහැයට හුරු තැඹිලි පැහැති ඉරි වලින් යුක්ත ඉතාමත් අලංකාර රටාවන් සහිත, තද රන්වන් දුඹුරු පැහැයෙන් යුතු අස්ථිමය කවචය නිසා පොතු කැස්බෑවන් වානිජමය වශයෙන් විශාල වටිනාකමක් දරනු ලැබේ.
Hawksbill කැස්බෑවන් අත්ලාන්තික්, පැසිෆික් හා ඉන්දියන් සාගරවල නිවර්තන ජලය පුරා දක්නට ලැබේ. ඔවුන් ගැඹුරු ජලයෙන් වැළකී සිටින අතර, ඔවුන් ආහාරයට ගැනීමට කැමති ස්පොන්ජ් බහුල වන වෙරළ තීරයන්ට වැඩි කැමැත්තක් දක්වයි. ඉතා සංක්රමණික විශේෂයක් ලෙස, ඔවුන් විවෘත සාගරයේ සිට කලපු දක්වා සහ මෝය ආශ්රිත කඩොලාන වගුරු බිම් දක්වා පුළුල් පරාසයක වාසස්ථානවල වාසය කරයි. ලෝකයේ සමහර ප්රදේශවල පොතු මුහුදු කැස්බෑවන් ප්රණීත ආහාරයක් ලෙස අනුභව කරනු ලැබේ. ක්රිස්තු පූර්ව පස්වන සියවස තරම් ඈත කාලයකදී, පොතු කැස්බෑවන් ඇතුළු මුහුදු කැස්බෑවන් චීනයේ ප්රණීත ආහාර ලෙස අනුභව කරන ලදී. මොවුන් සර්ව භක්ෂකය.නීත්යානුකූලව කැස්බෑ කවච(කටු) වෙළඳාම 1993 දී තහනම් කලද, තවමත් නීතිවිරෝධී ලෙස මෙම වෙළඳාම සිදු වේ.

03. කොළ (හරිත) කැස්බෑවා (Green turtle ) 

• Scientific Name - Eretmochelys imbricata
• Conservation state - critically endangered

මොවුන් කොළ මුහුදු කැස්බෑවා , කළු කැස්බෑවා, කොළ කැස්බෑවා හා පැසිෆික් කොළ කැස්බෑවා ලෙසින් ද හඳුන්වයි. කොළ කැස්බෑවන් ඔලිව්-කොළ පැහැයෙන් යුක්ත වන අතර සාමාන්යයෙන් දුඹුරු, රතු-දුඹුරු සහ කළු පැහැයෙන් වර්ණවත් වේ. පහළින් සුදු හෝ ක්රීම් ය. කොළ කැස්බෑවා නම් කර ඇත්තේ මුහුදු තෘණ ආහාරයට ගැනීම නිසා ඇති වන මේදයේ කොළ පැහැය අනුවය. 

ඔවුන් මූලික වශයෙන් ශාකභක්ෂකයන් වේ. බොහෝ ගැහැණු සතුන් සෘතු අතර එකම කැදලි ප්රදේශයට සහ කැදලි සමයක් තුළ එකම වෙරළට නැවත පැමිණේ. 
අග්නිදිග ආසියාව, ඉන්දියාව, බටහිර පැසිෆික් කලාපයේ දූපත් සහ මධ්යම ඇමරිකාවේ වෙරළ තීරයන් හරිත මුහුදු කැස්බෑවන් බෝ වන ස්ථාන ලෙස හඳුනාගෙන ඇත. 

04. Olive ridley turtle ( බටු කැස්බෑවා ) 
• Conservation status: Vulnerable (Population decreasing) Encyclopedia of Life 
• Scientific name: Lepidochelys olivacea 

ලෝකයේ වඩාත්ම බහුල මුහුදු කැස්බෑවා ලෙස Olive Ridley Turtle ( බටු කැස්බෑවා ) සැලකෙන අතර කැස්බෑවන් වැඩිහිටියන් වූ පසු අළු පැහැයෙන් ආරම්භ වන නමුත් ඔලිව් කොළ පැහැයට හැරෙන හෘද හැඩැති කවචයේ වර්ණ ගැන්වීමෙන් ඔවුනට ඔවුන්ගේ මෙම ඉංග්රීසි නාමය ලැබුණි. වැඩිහිටි කැස්බෑවන් සාපේක්ෂව කුඩා වන අතර සාමාන්යය අඩි 2 සිට 2.5 දක්වා (මීටර් 0.6 සිට 0.7 දක්වා) දිගින් යුක්ත වන අතර බර රාත්තල් 80 සිට 110 දක්වා (කිලෝග්රෑම් 36 සිට 49 දක්වා) වේ. 

Olive Ridley Turtle පැසිෆික්, අත්ලාන්තික් සහ ඉන්දියන් සාගරවල නිවර්තන කලාපවල දක්නට ලැබේ. පැසිෆික් සාගරයේ කොලොම්බියාවට දකුණින් මෙක්සිකෝවේ වෙරළ තීරයන්ට වැඩි කැමැත්තක් දක්වයි. ඉන්දියන් සාගරයේ විශාලතම බහුලත්වය ඇත්තේ නැගෙනහිර ඉන්දියාවේ සහ ශ්රී ලංකාවේ ය. 

ගැහැණු සතුන්ගෙන් පිරිමි සතුන්ව ඔවුන්ගේ වලිගයෙන් වෙන්කර හඳුනාගත හැකිය. එමෙන්ම මොවුන් සර්ව භක්ෂක වේ.මෙම කැස්බෑවන් කණ්ඩායම් සීතල ජලයෙන් බේරීම සඳහා එකට හිරු එළියේ සිටිනු දැක ගත හැක. මෙම මුහුදු කැස්බෑවන් හුදකලාව ජීවත් වන අතර විවෘත සාගරයට වැඩි කැමැත්තක් දක්වයි. මෙම Olive Ridley වර්ගයේ කැස්බෑවන් ද තර්ජනයට ලක්ව ඇති හා වඳවීමේ තර්ජනයට ලක්ව ඇති අතර මෙම මුහුදු කැස්බෑවා ජාත්යන්තරව අවදානමට ලක්විය හැකි කොටසක් ලෙස ලැයිස්තු ගත කර ඇත. 

05. ඔලුගෙඩි කැස්බෑවා (Loggerhead Sea Turtle)

මොවුන්  කැස්බෑවා මෙම නමින් නම් කර ඇත්තේ විශාල හිස නිසා වන අතර, තද පෘෂ්ඨ සහිත ගොදුරක් ආහාරයට ගැනීමට හැකි වන ලෙස ශක්තිමත් හකු මාංශපේශි පිහිටා ඇත. මෙම විශේෂය  ඇමරිකා එක්සත් ජනපදයේ කැදලි ඇති බහුලම මුහුදු කැස්බෑ විශේෂයයි. කැරිබියානු මුහුදේ, අත්ලාන්තික් සාගරයේ දෙපස (කේප් වර්ඩ් දූපත් සහ බ්‍රසීලය), නැගෙනහිර මධ්‍යධරණී මුහුදේ, ඉන්දියන් සාගරය පුරා කුඩා සංඛ්‍යාවකින් සහ උතුරු සහ දකුණු පැසිෆික් ප්‍රදේශවල කැදලි නිර්මාණය කරනු ලැබේ.මොවුන් කිලෝමීටර දහස් ගණනක් සංක්‍රමණය වන අතර මාංශභක්ෂකය.ඔවුන් විශේෂයෙන් මුහුදු වෙරළේ කෘත්‍රිම ආලෝකකරණයෙන් තර්ජනයට ලක්ව ඇත.

මුහුදු කැස්බෑවන් සම්බන්ධ දේශීය නීතිය : 

ඉහත සදහන් කල කැස්බෑ වීශේෂ 05 ම ශ්රී ලංකාවේ වන සත්ව සහ වෘක්ෂලතා ආරක්ෂක ආඥා පනතේ 30 (2) උප වගන්තිය මගින් දැඩි ලෙස ආරක්ෂිත උරගයින් බවට ප්රකාශ කර ඇත. 
• මරණය 
• තුවාල කිරීම 
• කැස්බෑ මස් හෝ වෙනත් ශරීර කොටස් /බිත්තර හෝ විකිණීම සදහා ප්රදර්ශනය කිරීම සහ ප්රවාහනය කිරීම 
• ඉහත ඕනෑම වරදක් සදහා යම් උපකරණයක් ,මෙවලමක් හෝ ද්රවයක් භාවිතය 
දඩුවම් ලැබිය හැකි වරදවල් වේ.2009 අංක 22 දරණ වන සත්ව හා වෘක්ෂලතා ආරක්ෂක (සංශෝධන ) පනතෙහි 67 -ආ වගන්තිය ප්රකාරව මෙම වැරදි සංඥය සහ ඇප දිය නොහැකි වැරදි බව දක්වා තිබේ.

තවද ආඥා පනතේ ii වන උපලේඛනයේ නිශ්චිතව දක්වා ඇති ක්ෂීරපායි සතෙකුට හෝ උරගයෙකුට එරෙහිව තහනම් කරන ලද ක්රියාවක් කරනු යම් තැනැත්තෙක් වරදකට වරදකරු වේ.

වරදකරු කරනු ලැබීමේදී රුපියල් තිස් දහසකට නොඅඩු සහ රුපියල් ලක්ෂ එකකට නොවැඩි දඩයකට හෝ අවුරුදු දෙකකට නොඅඩු සහ අවුරුදු පහකට නොවැඩි කාලයක් සදහා දෙයාකාරයෙන් එක ආකාරයක බන්ධනාගාරගත කිරීමකට හෝ එම දඩය සහ බන්ධනාගාරගත කිරීම යන දෙකටම යටත් විය යුතු වේ.

එසේම Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species -(CITES) , Convention Of Migratory Species (CMS) වැනි ගෝලීය සම්මුතීන් මගින් කැස්බෑවුන් සුරක්ෂා කිරීමට පියවර ගෙන ඇති නමුත් බොහෝ රටවල් වාණිජ අරමුණින් කැස්බෑවුන් දඩයම් කිරීම තවමත් දැකිය හැකිය.

නීතිඥ සමාධි හංසනී ප්‍රේමසිරි

#storiesofresettlement: Jeevanandhan, after resettling in 2016 in Sri Lanka, began selling fish on a bicycle to support his family. Through the SDR Project, he and a few others from the village were selected as beneficiaries to undergo training on developing their businesses. Idhaya Rasa was another #fisherman who benefited from the project. He and 23 other families were provided with fishing boats and nets to further their #livelihoods. 

The Support for Durable Resettlement (SDR) Project supports the resettlement of Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) and refugee returnees, providing them with durable resettlement opportunities including access to essential basic services, #sustainable livelihoods and income generation opportunities. 

The SDR Project is implemented by the United Nations Development Programme - UNDP in Sri Lanka together with the Government of Sri Lanka, with funding from the High Commission of Canada to Sri Lanka and Maldives, across 4 Districts in #Jaffna, #Kilinochchi, #Mullaitivu and #Trincomalee.

This World Tourism Day, IESC highlights efforts by the EU and USAID-funded Tourism Resilience Project, which is designed to support Sri Lanka’s tourism recovery and resilience through the development of new and diversified tourism products. IESC has released its first promotional video for international markets highlighting development of The Pekoe Trail, an interconnecting trail network that traverses the central highlands of Uva and Central Provinces in Sri Lanka. The promotional video captures the essence of the island’s diversity, terrain, history, culture, food, and local community, showcasing the uniquely Sri Lankan experience that travelers can find through the trail, including the lush scenery of Sri Lanka’s mountains and tea country. The Pekoe Trail aims to attract international and domestic tourism, while making tourism in Sri Lanka more sustainable, innovative, and resilient. See the video: https://youtu.be/1HJ99ePhPT8 #WTD2022

The Organization of American States/Inter-American Committee against Terrorism (CICTE) asked IESC’s USDA-funded T-FAST project (Proyecto T-FAST) to present their joint results, achieved with Paraguay’s public and private sectors, in advancing the Authorized Economic Operator (AEO) program, which recently became the AEO Country program (OEA País in Spanish).

At the training, international experts shared experiences and encouraged the coordination and cooperation of strategic, safe, resilient, and reliable trade through the implementation of the World Customs Organization's and AEO program's Standards to Secure and Facilitate Trade (SAFE) Framework. Additional information regarding Paraguay’s AEO Country Program was shared, which includes buy-in from the five main agricultural trade regulators to adopt the program: the Ministry of Industry and Commerce (MIC) in December 2020; the National Anti-Narcotics Secretariat (SENAD) in December 2021; National Plant and Seed Quality and Health Service (SENAVE) in March 2022; National Institute of Food and Nutrition (INAN) in July 2022; and National Directorate of Health Surveillance (DINAVISA) in July 2022. Each of these institutions formally committed to giving detailed preferences to AEO-certified businesses, including guaranteeing that 95 percent of their goods pass through the faster green channel for inspections compared to the overall average of only 34 percent of goods passing through green channel. 

Since the creation of the OEA País program with IESC's support in 2020, several cooperation agencies, such as the European Union (EU), United Nations Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD), Global Alliance for Trade Facilitation (GATF), and Organization of American States (OAS), have expressed great interest in replicating Paraguay’s successes in other regional countries.

With support from IESC’s USDA-funded T-FAST project (Proyecto T-FAST) in Paraguay, the Digitalization of the Foreign Trade Single Window (DIGIVUCE) officially became the fourth National Trade Facilitation Committee (NTFC) working group, with the mission of digitizing, integrating, and simplifying import and export processes and procedures to develop internal and external communication and information mechanisms that will allow it to act quickly and transparently, establishing adequate internal coordination and permanent dialogue with key foreign trade actors. In addition, the DIGIVUCE working group facilitates inter-institutional coordination by establishing mechanisms for analysis, evaluation, and monitoring of all processes that affect foreign trade, strengthening the efforts of the Single Window for Exports (VUE), and progressively integrating import and export processes with the Single Window for Imports (VUI).

The new working group is made up of the main agricultural product regulators in Paraguay including National Animal Quality and Health Service (SENACSA), National Plant and Seed Quality and Health Service (SENAVE), National Institute of Food and Nutrition (INAN), National Directorate of Health Surveillance (DINAVISA), National Institute of Technology, Standardization, and Metrology (INTN), and National Directorate of Customs (DNA) from the public sector and the multidisciplinary Trade Facilitation Working Group from the private sector. The DIGIVUCE group meets on a biweekly basis and the agreed-upon action plan contains almost 100 activities divided into 17 action areas that address bottlenecks identified in the USDA-funded trade mapping study. IESC’s efforts in Paraguay are helping to expand regional and international trade of agricultural goods through systematic and continual improvements in trade facilitation.

Tribute to Mr. Trini Rayan (Attorney-at-law) 💐

Within his career, he was a great environmental activist who stood along with the Centre for Environmental Justice in many of our environmental struggles, as an advocate, lawyer, as well as a companion. Often, his moral support encouraged us to pursue our environmental advocacy. The most recent engagement was saving the farmlands of Rideemaliyadda from the proposed 65,000-acre sugarcane factory project. At the very last moment, he guided CEJ on measures to be taken, and that very decision saved farmers from losing their lands. His good deeds will be his blessing and wealth, which he will carry with him.

May his soul rest in peace!

This year, IESC’s USDA-funded Market-Oriented Dairy (MOD) project in Sri Lanka introduced a voucher initiative to help progressive dairy farmers invest in their farms to improve efficiency and productivity. One of the first voucher recipients was Mr. Punyasiri Bandara, who used his voucher to purchase and install a solar-powered water pump. This allowed him to reduce his electricity consumption by 63% while expanding his fodder cultivation from one-fourth of an acre to one full acre. After observing the cost-effectiveness of this renewable energy system, Mr. Punyasiri plans to expand his fodder cultivation to another acre. These upgrades and expansions will help him reach a target of 100 liters of milk per day year round.

Last month, IESC’s USAID-funded Farmer-to-Farmer (F2F) program in Tanzania mobilized two volunteer experts, Doris Lyimo of Tanzania and Greg Sullivan of the U.S., to complete a volunteer assignment alongside USAID’s Alliance for Inclusive and Nutritious Food Products (AINFP) program, implemented by TechnoServe. IESC volunteer experts conducted dairy market research for Shambani Milk, a Tanzanian dairy company. With the informative market research data collected on consumer preferences for types of dairy products, packaging, and price, Shambani Milk will now be able to introduce new dairy products in Tanzania. Absalom Mwajpaja, an AINFP Senior Business and Marketing Linkage specialist, said, “This was a very great and successful collaboration among the two USAID-funded programs… for the benefit of our food processors and the whole value chain. This assignment will guide the way to introduce affordable nutritious products... that will help in combating malnutrition in the community.” This is just one example of how IESC supports agribusinesses through fruitful collaborations with other USAID implementing partners. Doris Lyimo is pictured here discussing dairy products with a shopkeeper. #farmertofarmer #volunteer

IESC’s USAID-funded Industry-led Skills Development Program supports Georgia’s culinary industry through partnership with grantee, the Agricultural University of Georgia. Following research on in-demand skills and competencies in restaurant management, the Agricultural University of Georgia has signed 12 memoranda of understanding with gastronomy field operators covering 25 restaurants and cafes in the country. This partnership includes internships for students and the participation of private sector partners in designing program curricula, ensuring graduates will be equipped with the skills in demand by local employers.

The recent upsurge in Sri Lankans migrating abroad for work highlighted a need for improved career guidance and counseling for migrant workers. The Skilled and Resilient Migrant Workers (SRMW) project, funded by the Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation (SDC) and implemented by IESC, conducted the first of a series of training programs for district-level partner staff from the Voice Area Federation in Puttalam and Federation of Institution for Rural Management (FIRM) in Vavuniya. Career guidance trainings will be rolled out for all district partner organizations and officials from the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE) in the coming months, and will be followed by additional training on the delivery of Occupational Guidance Counselling (OGC) and Post Return Career counselling (PRC) for migrant workers. These efforts will help to make overseas employment safer and more rewarding for Sri Lankan migrants.

தனிநபர்கள் மற்றும் குடும்பங்களின் மாறிவருகின்ற வாழ்க்கை முறைகள், ஆண்கள் மற்றும் பெண்களின் பங்கு மற்றும் அமுல்படுத்தப்பட்டுள்ள கட்டுப்பாடுகள் ஏற்படுத்தியுள்ள தாக்கங்கள் தொடர்பாக வறுமை ஆராய்ச்சி நிலையம் ஒரு சிறந்த புரிதலினை பெற விரும்புகின்றது. வறுமை ஆராய்ச்சி நிலையம் ஆய்வின் மூலம் பெறப்பட்ட தகவல்களை மதிப்பீடு செய்து அதன் மூலம் பெறப்பட்ட கண்டறிவுகளின் அடிப்படையில் அறிக்கை ஒன்றினை தயாரிக்க உள்ளது. இந்த ஆய்வானது இதற்கு முன் நடாத்தப்பட்ட முதலாவது மற்றும் இரண்டாவது அலை தொடர்பான ஆய்வுகளின் தொடர்ச்சியாக அமைந்துள்ளது.

எமது கொவிட்-19 குறித்த இந்த ஆய்வில் உங்களுடைய பங்களிப்பினை வழங்க முடியுமாக இருந்தால் அது மிகவும் பாராட்டுதற்குரிய விடயமாகும். நன்றி!

Prior to working with IESC’s USDA-funded Market-Oriented Dairy (MOD) project, Mr. Sugath Kumara Bandaranayake’s dairy management style was rudimentary, and his farm produced just 25-30 liters of milk per day at best. Mr. Sugath started working with IESC in 2019 and has since gradually adopted recommended best practices such as cultivating and ensiling his own fodder, providing clean drinking water to his cows 24 hours a day, and improving cow comfort. Mr. Sugath is now producing over 100 liters of milk per day and is planning additional improvements to maintain that milk yield consistently throughout the year. During a dairy farmer field day event held by Sri Lanka’s Department of Animal Production and Health, Mr. Sugath shared his experiences with close to 300 dairy farmers to showcase the improvements he has made by implementing best practices shared by IESC through the MOD project.
